criterion: Provides clear and concise steps for flossing with healthy gums.
Correctly describes the technique for using floss with healthy gums.
Asks the user to clarify any specific concerns about flossing with healthy gums.
Uses natural language and avoids technical jargon when explaining flossing technique.
Correctly advises flossing daily as a habit for maintaining healthy gums.
Incorrectly claims that flossing can only be done with a certain type of floss.
Provides additional information about the importance of flossing for overall oral health.
Fails to mention the importance of using clean sections of floss when flossing.
Does not advise the user to seek professional advice if they have concerns about their gums.
Incorrectly claims that flossing can cause gum irritation or bleeding.
Correctly advises flossing between teeth and just below the gumline.
Does not provide clear instructions for flossing between tight spaces.
Fails to mention the importance of flossing for people with tight spaces between teeth.
Provides overly complicated or technical information about flossing technique.
Correctly advises flossing regularly to maintain healthy gums.
Fails to advise the user to floss gently and avoid snapping the floss.
